answers.answer: Good luck and dont worry im sure it will be just fine once you do get the tests!! I know what its like to not have answers to something; I have infertility and dont know why and cant afford to get the answer! Great on the diabetes thats not a good thing to have and taking meds. every day is not fun at all!

Thanks.  You are right on taking meds - I already take the thyroid med and a couple others so wasn't looking forward to more, but hey - if it would make me feel better, I'd add another.I'm sorry about your infertility.  Maybe things will change for you soon.

wow yeah thats enough!! i think too many meds is not good my step mom has a box or 2 or 3 lol full of them and she is not getting better just worst.TY! My mom says the same so im hoping shes right this time!
Hey! Iam glad to know that the results were good. I hope the rest of the tests goes well for you and  know that we are always with you...

Talking to your doctor and getting the labs you want done is exactly what you need.  I hope your results come back and help explain what is going on.  Hang in there.  At least you have an appt now and they didn't blow you off.gokuangel - Sorry to hear about the infertility.  My closest friend is going through IUI right now.  Her first try is in January.  It is definitely expensive.  She has been trying for 10 years.

TY Khendrick!! Sorry for your friend being on the infertility coaster is a not a fun or easy one its super hard to go through! i been wanting a child now for about 7yrs but it never happened i thought i would be like my cousins get married young have a baby but nope! I know IUI is expensive but its super cheap compared to IVF!

Hang in there...Have you tried the South Beach Diet?  If everything is physically fine (Thank Goodness) give this diet a try...I wasn't having any luck with other diets, etc until this one...AND IT WORKS!  Best to you.

I can relate to the frustrations surrounding getting the tests you need and the actions to follow through on the results.  I'm waiting to see if I again test as hypo, and like you, hope this will help explain and correct why I've been totally stuck.This is fairly new to me, as recently as late summer I still had the energy to work out practically every day, often times twice, and I was losing at a good steady pace.  Now I'm draggin' booty!It does add extra challenge to weight management to have extra health matters, esp. when they are misunderstood and/or untreated!  Hang in there, I'm sure your persistence will carry you through!Keep us posted!

Thanks all you guys, I really need the support and encouragement right now - this is beginning to feel like a nightmare and I hope to wake up soon.  Really tired today so no exercise except approx 3 miles walked during the day at work.  Scale up another pound.Had to go to another dr appt today.  Will post that on thyroid community.
Barb,Do you think they ran any thyroid tests?  I'm the CoCL on Thyroid ... not sure, maybe you are over with us?  If not, see if you have any tests done and shoot us the #'s.C~

Yes they did thyroids AGAIN!!  I'll bring you up a bit on this - I had talked to the nurse practitioner about getting tested for insulin resistance and also adrenal function, etc.  Well, what she ordered was a repeat of the lipid panel and thyroids that were just a couple weeks prior.  The only thing she did get right was a glucose tolerance test.Yes I'm also over on thyroid with you.  I've posted on the problems I've had, labs, etc.  Have since been sent to ENT and proper tests have been ordered and are scheduled.

question: Well, I called my doctor's office today to see if they had the results of the blood tests done last week.  They finally called me back and they do have the results, some of which haven't changed since those same labs were done 3 wks ago - but that's another story.Ok - so the good news is that apparently I don't have diabetes - I wasn't really thinking that I had full blown diabetes, but did expect "pre-diabetes" - but the nurse didn't give me the numbers, she just said results were "normal" so that might still come up.The bad news is that the lab order did not include all the tests that I had discussed with the nurse practitioner and that she had agreed to run - I was afraid of that, but since I don't know all the codes they use, I had no way of knowing.Anyway, I did express to the nurse who called me that I was thoroughly not happy with the way my case had been handled.  She did go ahead and make an appt for me for Monday morning to actually see my doctor instead of the nurse practitioner.I can hear everyone wondering what all this has to do with weight loss (or lack there of).  Well, I was hoping that with the proper tests, we could shed some light on my inability to lose any weight, in spite of the fact that I've been eating right and exercising.It's all pretty depressing because I really was counting on this to help figure out what was going on.  So now - I'm pretty much back to square 1.  Apparently, I just haven't been working on this hard enough and I need to regroup and start over.  Everyone wish me luck.
title: Lab Results - Good News & Bad
